title: Carroll County Time 2023 Pictures of the year | PHOTOS – Baltimore Sun
body_text:
Photographs record an instant in time, a moment that may otherwise be missed in the blink of an eye. Whether a news event, the play of the game, a tender moment between two people, or pieces of everyday life, photographs tell a story. They can lift imagination, capture the energy of a subject and evoke emotions. Anyone with a mobile phone can take a picture, but professionals pay close attention to details that an untrained eye can take for granted, such as the subject matter, composition, perspective, lighting or weather. On the following pages, we give you a second look at some of The Carroll County Times’ best photographs of 2023 – Our Pictures of the Year – A Photo Finish. To see more pictures of the year go to: carroll-county-times/
Jeffrey F. Bill / Senior Content Editor, Baltimore Sun Media
Glenelg's Ava Rivera, Kam Henson, and Cece Cassity chase after a ground ball with Manchester Valley's Casey Meredith in the first half. Manchester Valley takes a 10-9 overtime win over visiting Glenelg to win the Regional Championship Monday night in Manchester. (Doug Kapustin/for Carroll County Times)
Liberty's Mariah Williams raises the championship while surrounded by teammates following their win over Fallston during the Class 1A girls lacrosse championship at Stevenson University on Tuesday, May 23, 2023. (Brian Krista/Staff photo)
South Carroll players celebrate a goal by Caroline Tolle, 21, against Pocomoke during the Class 1A state field hockey championship at Paint Branch High School on Saturday, November 11, 2023. (Brian Krista/Staff photo)
Jaime Cacciola and her son Logan Lollar, 8, Frederick, seek Spring Peepers in "wetlands" of East West Park in Mt. Airy. Nearly 30 people gathered with buckets, nets and flashlights at East West Park in Mt. Airy In search of Spring Peeper, a small chorus frog, sponsored by Mt. Airy Parks and Recreation, Thursday March 23, 2023. The call of the Spring Peeper is a familiar sound throughout its range, and as it typically begins in March or early April, is considered one of the first harbingers of spring. (Jeffrey F. Bill/Staff photo)
Santa speaks with Isabelle Forrester, 5, during his final visit with the fire truck in Mount Airy on Dec. 23, 2023. (Thomas Walker/for Carroll County Times)
Dec. 07, 2023: Family members light a candle for Emily Kolb who died January 2, 2020. Candle Lighting Remembrance Ceremony presented by Catherine's Cause at Ascension Episcopal Church.The 17th Remembrance Ceremony honored all lives lost on Carroll County roads, including drunk driving crashes, including the eight lives lost between October 23, 2022 - September 2023. Catherine’s Cause was founded in 2007 after MADD left Carroll County, by Cindy & Phil Mullikin, in memory their daughter Catherine Mullikin, killed by a drunk driver November 28, 1998. (Jeffrey F. Bill/Staff photo)
Zoe Josephson and several of the “The Swimmin' Women” wait pool-side before the plunge. “The Swimmin' Women” are women of a "certain age" who take part in Aqua classes year round, participated in their own 3rd annual MSP Polar Bear Plunge on Thursday January 26, 2023 at Merritt Clubs Eldersburg. The group has raised $3,000 this year from this year’s plunge for Special Olympic Athletes. (Jeffrey F. Bill/Staff photo)
Westminster's Aline Shipley dives into the pool as she competes in the Women 15 & Over 100 Meter Freestyle during the Straehle Invitational Meet at Padonia Park Club on Wednesday, July 26, 2023. (Brian Krista/Staff photo)
Manchester Valley's Grant Miller, 25, runs with the ball during a boys lacrosse game between Manchester Valley and Century, Tuesday, April 11, 2023, in Manchester. Manchester Valley won 7-5. (Harrison Jones/for Carroll County Times)
Baltimore Ravens quarterback, Lamar Jackson greets young fans at the first annual Community Fun Day 'Catch-a-Turkey' event at Blaze Pizza in Westminster on Saturday. Frozen turkeys and Thanksgiving fare are distributed by volunteers and made possible through the collaborative efforts of Westminster Rescue Mission, Carroll County Food Sunday, and generous sponsors. (Doug Kapustin/for Carroll County Times)
Caleb Rheubottom and Jay Blair ride the Paratrooper at the Sykesville Freedom District Fire Department Carnival on June 10, 2023. (Thomas Walker/for Carrol County Times)
Joules Drenner runs through a twisting barrel at the Sykesville Freedom District Fire Department Carnival on June 10, 2023. (Thomas Walker/for Carrol County Times)
Westminster's Jordan Sloan meets Oakdale's Ava Bilali at the net in game one. Westminster takes a 3-1 victory over visiting Oakdale in their first round playoff match Thursday night in Westminster. (Doug Kapustin/for Carroll County Times)
Westminster's Gabe Dintino gets to a header in front of Manchester Valley's Reid Bartles in the second half. Westminster tops visiting Manchester Valley, 3-2, Thursday night in Westminster. (Doug Kapustin/for Carroll County Times)
Westminster center fielder, Ryley Winebrunner nearly makes a spectacular catch but loses the ball while toppling over the fence on a home run off the bat of Manchester Valley's Caitlin Boden in the fourth inning. Westminster holds on to take a 9-7 win over visiting Manchester Valley Friday afternoon in Westminster. (Doug Kapustin/for Carroll County Times)
Manchester Valley center fielder, Angel Stewart makes a diving attempt at a line drive off the bat of South Carroll's Jackson Strzelczyk that winds up going for a triple. South Carroll defeats host, Manchester Valley 17-3 Wednesday evening in Manchester.
(Doug Kapustin/for Carroll County Times)
Winters Mill quarterback Caleb Crouch runs past Liberty's Nico Marsicano during a football game at Winters Mill High School on September 29, 2023. (Thomas Walker/for Carrol County Times)
Westminster's Ashton Gifford reacts after missing a first half opportunity. Westminster stages a second half comeback to defeat host, Liberty, 4-3 Tuesday night in Eldersburg. (Doug Kapustin/for Carroll County Times)
Westminster's Ashton Gifford (L) and Liberty's Tyler Krema attempt to gain possession in the first half. Westminster stages a second half comeback to defeat host, Liberty, 4-3 Tuesday night in Eldersburg. (Doug Kapustin/for Carroll County Times)
Manchester Valley's Braeden Fourhman can only manage to grab the jersey of Perry Hall's Noah Williams as the Gators running back looks to find the edge in the first half. Perry Hall dominates host, Manchester Valley, 46-7 Friday night in Manchester. (Doug Kapustin/for Carroll County Times)
Stella Coldsmith performs as part of Lune Indigo during Liberty High School's 12th Annual Rock for Liberty Battle of the Bands Saturday night in Eldersburg. The event showcased seven youth rock bands and benefitted the instrumental music program at the school. (Doug Kapustin/for Carroll County Times)
Elise Olmstead (2) sips hot chocolate at the Mount Airy Main Street Association's annual Hot Chocolate Crawl on Main Street Downtown on February 11, 2023. (Thomas Walker/for Carrol County Times)
Fallen power poles lie along Route 140 between route 97 and Market Street in Westminster Monday August 7, 2023. (Katherine Cedeno/for Carroll County Times)
Rory Frei, 2, plays a game of cornhole by his own rules during the Maryland SummerFest at the Carroll County Farm Museum on August 26, 2023. (Thomas Walker/for Carrol County Times)
Nine-year-old Lilly Matarese is all smiles as she passes through a tunnel formed by volunteers during he final evening of the season as the Freedom Shooting Stars celebrates its participants. The free program is open to all children ages 5-18 with physical, mental or emotional special needs. They have the chance to enjoy the fun of soccer with volunteers of all ages. The program is less about playing games of soccer and more about developing soccer skills and having fun running around in a field. (Doug Kapustin/for Carroll County Times)
Kids run the bases as they're introduced during "Opening Day" for the Four County Little League Monday night in Mount Airy. The festivities were originally scheduled for Saturday before bad weather forced postponement. (Doug Kapustin/for Carroll County Times)
Maryland Midland Railway train partial derailment in in Finksburg Carroll County at Sandymount Rd and Patapsco Rd., Thursday May 25, 2023. No one injured, the last car completed sideways, train was running off the tracks for some distance before crossing the bridge and derailing completely. Close call on the historic office building next to tracks called the “whistle stop” near miss. Train took out old historic signs and the utility box. (Katherine Cedeno/for Carroll County Times)
Lisa Patterson looks for last minute rubber duck sponsors at the Dream Big Union Bridge: Rubber Duck Derby on May 20, 2023.
(Thomas Walker/for Carrol County Times)
Squid Dushi, a 1-year old Dachshund, gets a blessing from Pastor Eric Deibler.The Blessing of the Animals took place at Calvary Lutheran Church in Mt. Airy on October 8, 2023. (Nate Pesce/for Carrol County Times)
Scarlet sugar maples blaze in the morning sun at the Uniontown Methodist Cemetery. (Phil Grout/for Carroll County Times)
Ashlynn Harrison has firm control of her 2nd place Angus Heifer during the opening day of the Carroll County 4-H and FFA Fair at the Carroll County Ag Center on July 29, 2023. (Thomas Walker/for Carrol County Times)
Aria Green, 5, of Westminster, is excited as she meets a baby cow in the petting zoo area. The 12th Taneytown Annual Harvest Festival was held at Taneytown Memorial Park on September 30, 2023. (Nate Pesce/for Carrol County Times)
Amanda Krumrine, instructor of the Coding with Pepper class, interacts with the robot. The Westminster Library Exploration Commons Maker Space offers a coding class to program the multifunctional robot Pepper. (Nate Pesce/for Carrol County Times)
Exhibitor Holden Freeman adjusts the stack of his Corgi Quincy for the Fitting and Showing competition during the 2023 Carroll County 4-H & FFA Fair Dog Show at the Shipley Arena in Westminster, MD on Saturday, July 15, 2023. (Haldan Kirsch/for Carrol County Times)
A South Carroll receiver fights to pull down the ball against a Westminster defender during 7 on 7 high school football scrimmages at Winters Mill High School in Westminster, MD on Wednesday, June 28, 2023. (Haldan Kirsch/for Carrol County Times)
Carnival rides are silhouetted by a hazy sunset during the 4 County Lions Community Carnival at the Fireman’s Carnival Grounds in Mt. Airy, MD on Wednesday, June 7, 2023. Smoke from wildfires in Canada drifted down into Eastern Maryland where they caused hazy skies and poor air quality. (Haldan Kirsch/for Carrol County Times)
Fire Chief Chad Green, right, serves up an order of French fries for Brenda Burdette while working one of the food stalls at the Union Bridge Fire Company Carnival in Union Bridge, MD on Thursday, June 1, 2023. (Haldan Kirsch/for Carrol County Times)
Easton Faulkner , 12, goes down the Super Slide at the New Windsor Fire Department’s annual carnival in New Windsor, MD on Friday, May 26, 2023. (Haldan Kirsch/for Carrol County Times)
Members of team Gear Rotation Annabelle Britten, left to right, Adit Gandhe, and Isha Netla pilot their robot during a playoff match of the FIRST Tech Challenge competition at Francis Scott Key High School in Union Bridge, MD on Saturday, January 28, 2023. Gear Rotation would unfortunately lose their first playoff match of the competition. (Haldan Kirsch/for Carrol County Times)
Dec. 7, 2023: Shelby, left, a Pasadena resident, takes a selfie with her mother Charlene, in front of a holiday tree decorating Sykesville's Main Street during a shopping trip to the town on Thursday. (Brian Krista/staff photo)
Dec. 14, 2023: Gabby Carbone places her mannequin head into a lightbox to be photographed by print production students as cosmetology students at Carroll County Career and Technology Center prepare for their annual Whoville Hairdo Competition. (Brian Krista/staff photo)
Dec. 21, 2023: Annual Blues Christmas and Homeless Memorial Service focusing on facing the challenges of the holiday season and remembering homeless people who have died in our community this year. (Jeffrey F. Bill/Staff photo)
The Westminster Class of 2023 arrives in the Gill Center for graduation. Westminster High School’s 123rd Graduation Exercises, Monday June 5, 2023 at McDaniel College Gill Center. (Jeffrey F. Bill/Staff photo)
Cal Ripken, Jr. and Greg Kahlert (center) cut the ribbon with the help of students as confetti falls to the ground. A school assembly and ribbon-cutting ceremony at Elmer A. Wolfe Elementary School for their new STEM center Tuesday May 9, 2023 included speeches from school officials, Greg Kahlert and Cal Ripken, Jr. who also explored the STEM room with students. Carroll County Public School classrooms have received new STEM centers thanks to a million-dollar donation partnership between the Kahlert and Cal Ripken Foundations. (Jeffrey F. Bill/Staff photo)
Wyatt Biden-Harrod, 5, climbs on the spider-web net climber before school Wednesday morning, September 20, 2023 at Westminster Community Playground. (Jeffrey F. Bill/Staff photo)
Francis Scott Key's Softball pitcher, Jasmine Kline, 2023 Player of the Year. (Jeffrey F. Bill/Staff photo)
Gerstell Academy pitcher Jon Delgado, 2023 Baseball Player of the Year. (Jeffrey F. Bill/Staff photo)
South Carroll #9, Rowan Miller, celebrates after scoring her 1st goal in the 2nd quarter.. FSK vs South Carroll regional field hockey final, Tuesday October 31, 2023 at Francis Scott Key High School. (Jeffrey F. Bill/Staff photo)
Century's Ryan Matthews attempts to get a shot off as he drives to the hoop between Hereford defenders during a boys basketball game at Century High School on Friday, February 17, 2023. (Brian Krista/Staff photo)
Sykesville resident, Mark Hamilton, gives testimony supporting the moratorium, citing the solar ordinance as it is currently written. Holding up the Carroll County Times newspaper, he asked "If you do not support the moratorium, do you want this to be the first thing you see as you walk out your front door every morning?" referencing a photo of the Shepherd's Mill Community Solar Project site in Union Bridge. The Carroll County Commissioners hosted a public hearing on a proposed ordinance establishing a six month moratorium of solar farms Thursday February 23, 2023 at the Carroll County Office Building. (Jeffrey F. Bill/Staff photo)
Lauren Schwartzbeck and her husband, Austin are pictured at their family farm, Peace and Plenty Farm, with two of their heifers, Jubie242 and Jubie44. The couple from Union Bridge met in 2019 while showing their cows at the Maryland State Fair and were married in 2021. They have two children, 1 year-old Cole and a one month old Addison. (Jeffrey F. Bill/Staff photo)
Sensei Glenda Walsh Crouse teaches Finn Kostick, 4, Woodbine, how to hold and play a violin. She is the director of Westminster Suzuki Strings. “Ready Set Violin class” provides opportunity to explore violin lessons without financial commitment. Families prepare for formal lessons during free, three-week class. Concepts are taught through play, games, stories and picture books. No violin required; the Suzuki method educates children in the same way they learn their native language, through immersion and begins on box violin and moves to real violin when child is ready. Ages 2-6. (Jeffrey F. Bill/Staff photo)
Sculptor Thomas Sterner discusses the final process of the lift with his friend visiting from New Mexico, Steven Berardelli, holding a guide-line. The 22 foot "Raventree" sculpture is lifted upright into position on a concrete footer in Wakefield Valley Park in Westminster. (Jeffrey F. Bill/Staff photo)
The second group of riders turn the corner at Falls Road and Hoffmanville Road as the Maryland Cycling Classic runs through a portion of Carroll County in Manchester Sunday September 3, 2023. (Jeffrey F. Bill/Staff photo)
Town Council Candidate, Vince Pacelli is given a quick demo in the voting booth, by Harold Webb of ELECTEC Election Services, Inc. The Town of Manchester municipal elections Tuesday May 16, 2023. Mayor Ryan M. Warner is running for reelection, against Melinda D. Smith who previously served on the Town Council from 2013 to 2021. Three candidates are running for two seats on the Town Council: incumbents Vincent C. Pacelli and Jennifer L. Miller, and Ryan H. Nazelrod. (Jeffrey F. Bill/Staff photo)
Tracey Werner takes a photo of her daughter Olivia Werner as Olivia's best friend, Giada Centofanti reacts when Olivia appears on the "big screen" at Liberty High School’s 42nd Graduation Exercises, Tuesday June 6, 2023 at McDaniel College Gill Center. (Jeffrey F. Bill/Staff photo)
Jessica Shockney lifts her son Hank, 2, in the air as her husband Steve, daughter Juliette, 10, son Zach, 6, and daugher Violet look on at Christmas Tree Park in Manchester, Saturday July 15, 2023.. Hank Shockney has survived a rocky first two years of life after being born without functioning kidneys. He is scheduled to receive a kidney from his mother Jessica next month. (Jeffrey F. Bill/Staff photo)
Fox45's Patrice Sanders watches as her daughter, Naomi, 9, attempts to dunk her mother by hitting the target with a softball. If the Boys & Girls Club hit its goal of $75,000, she agreed to enter the Polar Dunk Tank. They raised $126,540. The Boys & Girls Clubs of Carroll County Westminster, held its annual dunk tank fundraiser on Giving Tuesday, November 28, 2023. Six organizations went head-to-head in a money raising competition to fund the club's leadership program. The winners stayed dry while the losers surrendered to the polar dunk tank. (Jeffrey F. Bill/Staff photo)
Gateway Graduate Grace von Riegen looks in the mirror as she prepares for graduation. The Class of 2023 Gateway School Graduation ceremony at Carroll Community College’s Scott Center May 31, 2023. (Jeffrey F. Bill/Staff photo)
Brandon Green operates a Combine to cut and harvest the crop. Evan Staley, Sycamore Bridge Farm, is harvesting his corn weeks early in order to salvage his drought-damaged crop. The state has issued a drought warning, Wednesday September 20, 2023. Staley farms 700 acres in New Windsor and Westminster. (Jeffrey F. Bill/Staff photo)
Evan Staley, Sycamore Bridge Farm, is harvesting his corn weeks early in order to salvage his drought-damaged crop. The state has issued a drought warning, Wednesday September 20, 2023. Staley farms 700 acres in New Windsor and Westminster. (Jeffrey F. Bill/Staff photo)
Veteran Anthony Morrissette is all smiles as he starts his Cadillac for the 1st time as Aaron "Doc" Dockery, Jason R. Sidock Exec. Dir., Carroll County Veterans Independence Project, Brad Wilson, LMW Auto Repair mechanic, and Nicole Shifflett Veteran Advocate, Veterans Independence Project look on,right.
Kim Heard’s veteran father recently died and she and her husband David wanted to “give back” to the veteran community by donating her father’s car, to a veteran in need. They contacted Carroll County Veterans Independence Project, where Veteran Advocate, Nicole Shifflett contacted LaScula Motorworks who donated over $1000.00 in parts as well as the labor to have the car ready for the Veteran. David and Kim Heard run the family owned business A and A Contracting and have been Carroll County Residents for over 40 years. (Jeffrey F. Bill/Staff photo)
Class 37 Graduates applaud Michael Hagerty, left, as he is named recipient of the "Honerable Michael M. Galloway Distinguished Graduate Award" by the Honorable Fred S. Hecker during the Carroll County Drug Treatment Court Graduation, Class 37, held at Carroll Community College on Thursday, April 6. 2023. The award is named after the first Judge of the Carroll County Drug Treatment Court. The Carroll County Circuit Court's Adult Drug Treatment Court is a court-supervised program that combines treatment with individualized services to eligible drug offenders. In partnership with local enforcement agencies, the court employs a variety of strategies to help participants progress in treatment as they hold jobs or attend school.
Erma Jones, resident at The Terraces at Westminster, chooses an candy filled egg from Easter Bunny, life enrichment director Amy Elsaesser, during an Easter event at the retirement community on Friday, April 7, 2023. (Brian Krista/Staff photo)
Members of the Class of 2023, from left, Lily Ketterman, Olivia Walsh, Kayla Marks and Naomi Whitlow strike poses for a picture taken by classmate Owen Willoughby before the 19th annual graduation for Winters Mill High School, held at McDaniel College on Tuesday, June 6, 2023. (Brian Krista/Staff photo)
Morgan Wiles, 9, of Westminster indulges in a bite of her own Neapolitan pizza while participating in Small Chefs: Make Your Own Personal Pizza event organized by the City of Westminster Recreation and Parks at City Park on Tuesday, July 25, 2023. The city has by celebrating Park and Recreation Month with a variety of activities every day throughout July. (Brian Krista/Staff photo)
Dani Schorn, a firefighter/parademic with Carroll County Fire and Rescue, watches as an American flag is raised in a ladder truck following a parade to celebrate the 200th anniversary of the Westminster Fire Department on Saturday, October 7, 2023. (Brian Krista/Staff photo)
McKenzie Blackshine, 9, of Taneytown wears a scarecrow costume during the Tails of Taneytown "Howlaween" event held at Memorial Park on Saturday, October 28, 2023. (Brian Krista/Staff photo)
Taneytown residents Jon Tough, left, and Mads Intlekofer play on a seesaw in the Telebubbies outfits before the Tails of Taneytown "Howlaween" event held at Memorial Park on Saturday, October 28, 2023. (Brian Krista/Staff photo)
One-year-old McKenna Astlin of Union Bridge plays with a beaded necklace during Sykesville's Let Freedom Ring Parade on Saturday, July 1, 2023. (Brian Krista/Staff photo)
South Carroll's JoJo Gigliotti makes a tackle on Westminster's Isaiah Sprinkle during a football game at South Carroll High School on Friday, September 15, 2023. (Brian Krista/Staff photo)
South Carroll teammates, from left, Addison Tolle, Reese Athey, Emma Strzelczyk and Cailin Yankle celebrate with their medals following the team's 2-1 win over Pocomoke during the Class 1A state field hockey championship at Paint Branch High School on Saturday, November 11, 2023. (Brian Krista/Staff photo)
Westminster's Charlotte Houle makes a jump in the girls high jump event during the Carroll County Track and Field Championships at Manchester Valley High School on Thursday, May 11, 2023. (Brian Krista/Staff photo)
Century's Alayna Gifford, left, and Westminster's Hannah Toth run side-by-side in the girls 800 meter run during the Carroll County Track and Field Championships at Manchester Valley High School on Thursday, May 11, 2023. (Brian Krista/Staff photo)
Francis Scott Key's McKenna Lanza chips onto the 1st hole green during Carroll County's season opening golf tournament at Oakmont Green in Hampstead on Friday, August 18, 2023. (Brian Krista/Staff photo)
Manchester Valley's Brynn Ryan, left, tries to escape control by Northeast's Sophia Hodges in the final of the girls 110 weight class during the MPSSAA 2A-1A West Regional wrestling tournament at Manchester Valley High School on Saturday, February 25, 2023. (Brian Krista/Staff photo)
A helicopter aids in the stringing of transmission wires on the new poles along Route 140 in Westminster Friday, August 9, 2023. (Brian Krista/Staff photo)
Franklin Middle School student Chelsea Schaefer takes aim at a target as she competes in the 3D challenge during the NASP Maryland State Archery Tournament at the Carroll County Ag Center on Saturday, March 18, 2023. (Brian Krista/Staff photo)
John LaScuola, owner of LaScuola Motorworks, hands over the keys to a 2010 Subaru Forester to Nancy Gordon of Westminster, on Saturday, May 13, 2023. LaScuola Motorworks donated the vehicle, through The Shepherd's Staff of Carroll County, to the mother of 3 children. (Brian Krista/Staff photo)
Molly Knight of Friendship Valley Elementary gets help from McDaniel senior Chris Swayne as she takes part in a bowling activity during McDaniel College's 32nd annual Tournament of Champions on Friday, April 14, 2023. Over 100 special needs students from elementary and middle schools across Carroll County were individually paired with a McDaniel student to participate in a variety of athletic activities and challenges. (Brian Krista/Staff photo)
Gerstell 1st Grader Lorelei Daly holds a spider on her finger at a station focused on stream bugs at McDaniel Environmental Center in New Windsor on Friday, April 21, 2023. Gerstell's entire school, near 400 students, took part in an Earth Day field trip, which featured 18 stations of local environmental learning, service projects, community restoration and the installation of plants for a butterfly garden as a thank you gift to McDaniel College. (Brian Krista/Staff photo)
Members of the Class of 2023 process through Ward Memorial Arch prior to the senior investiture and honors convocation at McDaniel College on Friday, May 19, 2023. The traditional arch processional was one of several weekend activities as McDaniel College celebrated its 153rd Commencement for the Class of 2023 on Saturday, May 20. (Brian Krista/Staff photo)
Sloan Phelps, a Hampstead resident and Lowe's employee, works on painting trim around a doorway at the Boys and Girls Clubs of Carroll County's new home at the former North Carroll High School on Wednesday, October 4, 2023. Eighty-two employees from 11 Lowe's Home Improvement stores in the district (with each store donating $2,500 in supplies) volunteered their time to work on constructing the new North Carroll Clubhouse. (Brian Krista/Staff photo)
Ian McNally, left, and Kevin Sparks, groundskeeper at McDaniel College, spread salt on steps towards the athletic field on campus, as a storm delivered a wintry mix of precipitation in Westminster on Wednesday, January 25, 2023. (Brian Krista/Staff photo)
Jean Neudecker owner of Simmons Home Made Ice Cream, looks out the screen door of the family business as her great-granddaughter Sadie Huffman, enjoys a cone outside the store on Thursday June 22, 2023. The Snydersburg business is celebrating its 100th anniversary. (Brian Krista/Staff photo)
First Grade students at Hampstead Elementary, from left, Karsyn Weaver, Marianna Olley and LJ Ruland, make hearts with their hands as they participate in an a song perfomed by TAHIRA, a storyteller in the African oral tradition, during an assembly at the school on Wednesday, February 15, 2023. (Brian Krista/Staff photo)
Senior Julia Kohr is embraced by her sister Caroline as they pose before a family photo before the 64th annual graduation exercises for Francis Scott Key High School, held at McDaniel College on Wednesday, June 7, 2023. (Brian Krista/Staff photo)
Madison Taylor of Westminster looks over her shoulder as she models her recycled outfit made with wires during the Garden Party fashion show presented by Class of 2023 students in the Textile and Fashion Careers program at the Carroll County Career & Technology Center on Friday, January 13, 2023. (Brian Krista/Staff photo)
Third Grader Rylee Zancan, right, holds a toilet seat still as 1st Grader Sawyer Littleton plays the toilet toss game during the Econ Fair at Winfield Elementary School on Thursday, May 11, 2023. Third Graders at the school learned lessons in economics with groups producing either goods or services, and then selling their product in exchange for money which went to funding a scholarship for a South Carroll High School senior. (Brian Krista/Staff photo)
Lew Keyser, percussionist with the Carroll Singers, performs a song during a rehearsal with members of the Westminster Ringers on Tuesday, November 21, 2023. "Come On, Ring Those Bells" concerts, featuring combined performances by the local handbell choir and community chorus, are November 27 and 28, 7:30 pm at Westminster High School. (Brian Krista/Staff photo)
David Welsh of Woodbine judges a selection of eggs for quality and consistency in the poultry barn during the Carroll County 4-H & FFA Fair at the Carroll County Ag Center on Monday, July 31, 2023. (Brian Krista/Staff photo)
Dr. Scott Willens of Westminster, left, and other concerned citizens protest the legalization of recreational cannabis at the intersection of Maryland Route 140 and Center Street in Westminster on Friday, June 30, 2023. (Brian Krista/Staff photo)
blues harmonica class taught by Grammy nominee Guy Davis during Common Ground on the Hill at McDaniel College on Monday, July 3, 2023. (Brian Krista/Staff photo)
Sara Barre of Littlestown, Pa., shows a large strawberry to her 4-year-old daughter McKenna in the strawberry fields at Baugher's Orchards in Westminster on Saturday, May 27, 2023. (Brian Krista/Staff photo)
Members of South Carroll High School's Poms Team perform a routine outside the Walmart Supercenter in Sykesville, to draw attention to the "Stuff the Bus" campaign at the store on Tuesday, August 15, 2023. "Stuff the Bus" is part of the WBAL CARES campaign and encourages shoppers to donate school supplies at various Walmart stores in benefit of students in the Anne Arundel, Baltimore, Carroll, Harford and Howard counties between Aug. 14 -18, during Maryland Tax-Free Week. (Brian Krista/Staff photo)
Nine-year-old Alyssa Baylor, a new Sykesville resident, rides the zipline while enjoying the playground at Millard Cooper Park for the first time on Tuesday, August 29, 2023. (Brian Krista/Staff photo)
A woman pushing a stroller is seen reflected in a puddle as they use a crosswalk along Main Street in Westminster, following morning rain showers on Wednesday, February 22, 2023. (Brian Krista/Staff photo)
A Swallowtail butterfly feeds on a Mexican sunflower at The Sunflower Garden in Westminster on Thursday, September 7, 2023. The Sunflower Garden offers customers the opportunity to pick-your-own flowers and bouquets, or walk the various gardens to take photographs, usually open Wednesday through Sunday until early October. Hours of operation can be found on Google and their Facebook page. (Brian Krista/Staff photo)
Madelyn Frounfelker, 10, of Bel Air and Harford Gymnastics Club, competes on the uneven bars during the 2023 Anti-Bullying Invitational gymnastics event at the Shipley Arena on Saturday, January 21, 2023. The event was hosted by Synergy Sportz of Frederick with a percentage of the proceeds donated to PACER's National Bullying Prevention Center. (Brian Krista/Staff photo)
McDaniel senior Fine Art major, Ciara Hovell, of D.C., works on installing her drawings onto her designated wall space, while one of her paintings of self-expression, depicting lost identity, hangs beside her in the Rice Gallery at McDaniel College's Peterson Hall on Tuesday, April 25, 2023. The exhibition, "Inveritas: Discovery of the Self," runs until May 12, features select works from seven senior Fine Art majors and one minor, and has a grand opening on Thursday, April 27 from 5:30 to 7:30 , with an artist talk at 6pm. (Brian Krista/Staff photo)
Luke Parrish of Eldersburg unleashes a throw from a tee box while taking part in a friendly competition with his cousin Clayton Allred of White Hall, right, on the disc golf course at Patapsco Valley State Park - McKeldin Area on Friday, January 20, 2023. (Brian Krista/Staff photo)
Maryland Del. Justin Ready, (R-5A, Carroll Co.) holds the Presidential Air Medal of Honor, awarded to George Keeney, who served in the Vietnam War and is now in hospice care at his humble New Windsor rancher Monday June 19, 2023. (Karl Merton Ferron/Baltimore Sun Staff)
Governor Wes Moore talks with Carroll County officials while touring the downed power lines and poles on Route 140 in Westminster after powerful storms came through the area Monday evening. (Jerry Jackson/Baltimore Sun Staff)
Barricade situation in 1400 block of Fairmount Road in the Small Crossings neighborhood of Hampstead. Fairmount Road is cordoned off one block east of Main Street to McAllister Lane. (Amy Davis/Baltimore Sun Staff)
South Carroll senior lacrosse midfielder Shannon McTavish.
March 20, 2023. (Kenneth K. Lam/Baltimore Sun Staff)
A suitably dressed Bill Clare, of Finksburg, takes a hill on Green Street as he runs in the Celtic Canter on Saturday. This is the 10th year Clare has participated in the 5k, a fundraiser for Crossroads Missions. The race is held in historic downtown Westminster. (Kim Hairston/Baltimore Sun Staff)
Rachel Lipman, head winemaker at Loew Vineyards in Mount Airy, on Thursday, May 4, 2023. She is the youngest winemaker in Maryland at age 30. (Brian Krista/Staff photo)
Century's Cameron Rivera begins his trek during the rope bridge competition. Strikeforce Battalion's Army JROTC hosts and competes in its annual Drill and Raider stakes competition at Century High School on Saturday. Strikeforce is a magnet battalion comprised of Liberty, South Carroll, and Century High Schools. (Doug Kapustin/for Carroll County Times)
